Hi all,

 I would like to suggest removing the star ratings on this forum. It is open to abuse and actually is putting off people from posting craft here.

   Thoughts?

In addition to those calling for the ability to reduce the number of posts on a page, I would like to be able to increase them to the point where the threads are not paged at all.

If unpaged is not an option, as many posts as possible.

Edited January 10, 2016 by John FX
unmerging
I would suggest (if possible) the ability to selectively stop individual posts automerging, in threads like this one it is counterproductive.
Regarding MajorJims suggestion to remove stars globally I would suggest just removing them from the craft exchange subforum, in a similar way to how we can`t rep people on the games subforum.

Three things have vexed me in rapid succession today:

  • A post I made was double-posted. This is buggy behaviour.
  • I couldn't edit the second copy. I often find I can't edit posts I have made, for no readily apparent reason, whether or not I fill in the field saying why it was edited. This strikes me as either being a bug or a very non-obvious thing to be done when editing posts (which I don't know about). In the latter case it should be more obvious.
  • If I type a lower-case b followed by a right bracket, the editor thinks I wanted a . If I wanted a graphical smiley I would use the smiley selector above. Conversely, if I want to type a list of things like so: a) c) d), it is very annoying. Automatic interpolation of graphical smileys should be suppressed IMHO.

If possible, it would be nice to have an option to ignore a specific user's avatar in addition to the ignore signature, posts, and messages options we already have.

On the whole I like avatars, they're a great help for keeping track of who's who on a forum, so I'd rather not disable them completely (although I haven't found the option for that anyway). But there are invariably a few people whose avatars, for whatever reason, I'd rather not have to look at, and short of ignoring those users completely (which I also don't want to do) there doesn't appear to be a way to do this.

Not a huge deal, but would be appreciated if it's practical.
